dk.statsbiblioteket.util
Class Logs

java.lang.Object
  dk.statsbiblioteket.util.Logs

@QAInfo(state=QA_NEEDED,
        level=NORMAL)
public class Logs
extends java.lang.Object

Helper class for logging. Provides methods for expansion of arguments.

Method Detail

log

public static void log(org.apache.commons.logging.Log log,
                       Logs.Level level,
                       java.lang.String message,
                       java.lang.Throwable error,
                       boolean verbose,
                       java.lang.Object... elements)
Log the message and the elements to the log at the specified level. Elements are converted to Strings and appended to the message. Arrays, Lists and similar in the elements are expanded to a certain degree of detail.

Sample input/output: log(myLog, Level.TRACE, false, "Started test", null, 5, new String[]{"flim", "flam"}); expands to log.trace("Started test (5, (flim, flam))");

Parameters:
log - the log to log to.
level - the level to log to (e.g. TRACE, DEBUG, INFO...).
verbose - if true, the elements are expanded more than for false.
error - the cause of this logging. If null, no cause is logged.
message - the message for the log.
elements - the elements to log.

log

public static void log(org.apache.commons.logging.Log log,
                       Logs.Level level,
                       java.lang.String message,
                       java.lang.Throwable t)
Log a throwable with a message at a given log level.

Parameters:
log - The logger to log to
level - The log level at which the log entry shold be registered
message - Message string to log
t - Throwable which' stack trace will be included in the log

expand

protected static void expand(java.io.StringWriter writer,
                             java.lang.Object element,
                             int maxLength,
                             int maxDepth)
Expands a given object and writes the resulting string to writer.

Parameters:
writer - where to write the string representation.
element - the element to expand.
maxLength - the maximum number of sub-elements to write, if the given element is an array or a list.
maxDepth - the maximum numer of recursive calls, in case of lists or arrays.

expand

public static java.lang.String expand(java.util.List list,
                                      int maxLength)
Expand the list of Objects to a String, writing maxLength elements from the list.

Parameters:
list - the list to expand to a String.
maxLength - the maximum number of elements from the list to expand.
Returns:
a String-representation of the list.
